文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk1
证据片段: Zircaloy-2 and -4 are used widely in the nuclear industry as cladding and structural material for fuel rods because of good thermal. nuclear, and mechanical properties. as well as good resistance to corrosion

证据片段: Zircaloy-2 and -4 are used widely in the nuclear industry as cladding and structural material for fuel rods because of good thermal. nuclear, and mechanical properties. as well as good resistance to corrosion

证据片段: The intermetallic precipitates $Z \mathrm { r } _ { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b { \ b \Lambda } } } } } } } } } } } } ( \mathrm { N i } , \mathrm { F e } ) $ and $Z \mathrm { r } ( \mathrm { C r } , \mathrm { F e } ) _ { z }$ are present in as-fabricated Zircaloy-2

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk1
证据片段: corrosion rates in Zircaloy increase with decreasing precipitate diameter below a critical value of $\approx 0 . 1 8 \mu \mathrm { m }$
额外性质: {"critical_precipitate_diameter": "≈0.18 μm", "correlation": "corrosion rates increase with decreasing precipitate diameter below critical value"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk2
证据片段: The results for $Z \mathrm { r } ( \mathrm { C r } , \mathrm { F e } ) _ { 2 }$ precipitates show a temperature dependence of the dose to amorphization that is similar to the exponential dependence found under electron irradiation
额外性质: {"amorphization_critical_temperature": "580 K", "amorphization_mechanism": "related to occurrence of cascades", "amorphization_criterion": "T_c ≈ 0.3 T_m"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk2
证据片段: An amorphous layer is formed first at the interface and moves inwards at a velocity of $1 0 \ \mathrm { n m }$ per $1 0 ^ { 2 5 } ~ \mathrm { { n/m } } ^ { 2 }$
额外性质: {"amorphization_rate": "10 nm per 10²⁵ n/m²", "complete_amorphization_fluence": "≈10²⁶ n/m²", "precipitate_size": "0.2 to 0.3 μm diameter", "iron_depletion": "30% relative to initial value"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk2
证据片段: For $\mathrm { Z r } _ { 2 } ( \mathrm { N i } , \mathrm { F e } )$ precipitates there are comparatively less data available

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk2
证据片段: completely crystalline after 18 dpa irradiation at $5 8 0 ~ \mathrm { K }$

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk6
证据片段: Neutron - Chemical disordering caused by cascades supplemented at the precipitate/matrix interface by a departure from stoichiometry caused by ballistic mixing
额外性质: {"amorphization_mechanism": "chemical disordering with ballistic mixing", "free_energy_rise": "chemical disordering supplemented by departure from stoichiometry", "temperature_dependence": "increased annealing in cascades close to critical temperature", "qualitative_aspects": "preferential depletion of Fe from precipitates observed after amorphization"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk6
证据片段: Electron - Accumulation of vacancies in the lattice because of interstitial migration to surface. This is supplemented by chemical disordering
额外性质: {"amorphization_mechanism": "vacancy accumulation and chemical disordering", "free_energy_rise": "vacancy accumulation with interstitial migration to surface", "temperature_dependence": "sustainable vacancy supersaturation is lower near critical temperature", "qualitative_aspects": "high dose rates facilitate amorphization because vacancy concentration is higher for a given dose"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk6
证据片段: Ion - Chemical Disordering caused by cascades
额外性质: {"amorphization_mechanism": "chemical disordering", "free_energy_rise": "chemical disordering caused by cascades", "temperature_dependence": "long range vacancy reordering activated at critical temperature", "qualitative_aspects": "in inversion of relative precipitate stabilities from high to low temperature could indicate different amorphization mechanisms", "critical_temperature": "higher than for electrons and lower than for neutrons"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk7
证据片段: Under electron irradiation and low temperature ion irradiation, no changes in precipitate composition were observed upon amorphization
工艺步骤: electron irradiation, low temperature ion irradiation
额外性质: {"amorphization_behavior": "no changes in precipitate composition observed upon amorphization"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk7
证据片段: Under high temperature ion irradiation, no morphological changes were observed, but we did see a depletion in Fe and Cr from the precipitates
额外性质: {"composition_changes": "depletion in Fe and Cr from precipitates", "morphological_changes": "none observed"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk7
证据片段: neutron irradiated Zircaloy-4 to a fluence of about 9 dpa at a temperature of 300 to 330°C

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_044_chunk8
证据片段: Pressure tubes that form the primary pressure boundary in CANDU reactors are made of cold worked Zr-2.5Nb autoclaved in steam at 400°C to produce a black adherent oxide film of ~1 to 2 μm in thickness
